meanings.definition: An ancient manuscript text in book form.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist discovered a codex in the ruins.
meanings.sent2: The library had a rare codex from the Middle Ages.
meanings.sent3: The codex seemed to whisper secrets from the past.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a codex of memories, each page holding a different story.
meanings.sent5: The codex was a treasure trove of historical knowledge.

meanings.definition: A collection of laws or statutes.

meanings.sent2: The king ordered the creation of a new codex of regulations.
meanings.sent3: The codex of rules was so long, it took days to read through.
meanings.sent4: The codex of laws stood as a guardian of justice in the land.
meanings.sent5: The codex of statutes was a shield against chaos.

meanings.definition: A code or set of rules.
